qas.question: In which district is the Regional Coucil housed?
For how many years did the socialists governed the region?
How many council members will they have in 2016 from the union of the Right?
Who led the Union of the Right?

context: The Region of Île de France, including Paris and its surrounding communities, is governed by the Regional Council, which has its headquarters in the <a0_0>7th<a0_0/> arrondissement of Paris. It is composed of 209 members representing the different communes within the region. On December 15, 2015, a list of candidates of the Union of the Right, a coalition of centrist and right-wing parties, led by <a3_0>Valérie Pécresse<a3_0/>, narrowly won the regional election, defeating a coalition of Socialists and ecologists. The Socialists had governed the region for <a1_0>seventeen<a1_0/> years. In 2016, the new regional council will have <a2_0>121<a2_0/> members from the Union of the Right, 66 from the Union of the Left and 22 from the extreme right National Front.
